newsitem.title: CHILE: Chile Quebrada Blanca union, company to talk.
newsitem.headline: Chile Quebrada Blanca union, company to talk.

text.p: Unions and management at the Quebrada Blanca copper mine will hold talks Thursday evening to end the week-long strike at the pit, said union president Nelson Fuentes.
"We have been called to a meeting at 7 pm (2400 GMT)," Fuentes told Reuters by telephone from Iquique.
The meeting has been organized by a government labor relations body which has been acting as mediator between the union and the company, he said.
Fuentes said he was optimistic that the two sides would reach an agreement to resolve the dispute which began last week after wage talks broke down.
"We still have to decide some small issues," he said.
Quebrada Blanca CEO James Drake said Thursday that the company would not revise its final pay offer of a 15 percent increase in real terms over the next three years.
Quebrada Blanca is controlled by Vancouver-based Cominco Ltd and Teck Resources International.
The pit, which lies on a remote plateau near the Bolivian border, produces 75,000 tonnes of copper cathodes a year.
